etymology.description: semantic: 見 “see” + phonetic: 𦥯; simplified as 𦥯→𰃮 and 見→见.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the meaning of “seeing/perceiving” with a sound-bearing component, yielding the idea of perceiving or becoming aware. The phonetic 𦥯 guides the pronunciation, while 見 anchors the sense of perception.
etymology.simplification: Both components were graphically simplified to reduce strokes and standardize forms: phonetic 𦥯 to 𰃮 and semantic 見 to 见, aligning with Mainland script reform for ease of writing.

examples.chinese: 我觉得今天很冷(我覺得今天很冷)。
examples.english: I feel it’s very cold today.

examples.chinese: 她终于觉醒，开始新的生活(她終於覺醒，開始新的生活)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhōngyú juéxǐng, kāishǐ xīn de shēnghuó.
examples.english: She finally awakened and began a new life.

examples.chinese: 我察觉到空气里的变化(我察覺到空氣裡的變化)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ chájué dào kōngqì lǐ de biànhuà.
examples.english: I noticed a change in the air.
